question.text:
The following blanks can be filled only by numbers.

1. Gregor Mendel conducted hybridisation experiments on garden peas for (P) years.
2. Mendel selected (Q) true-breeding pea plant varieties.
3. In a human population, there are (R) alleles for ABO Blood group.
4. In Drosophila, genes for white eye and yellow body show (S)% recombination.

The correct arrangement is

solution.text: Gregor Mendel, conducted hybridisation experiments on garden peas for 7 years (1856-1863) and proposed the laws of inheritance in living organisms. Mendel selected 14 true-breeding pea plant varieties, as pairs which were similar except for one character with contrasting traits. In a human population there are 3 alleles for ABO Blood group (I<sup>A</sup>, I<sup>B</sup> and i). In Drosophila, genes for white eye and yellow body show 1.3 % recombination
